bibl.title: Gus Bendjus et al. v. Territory of Washington. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of Olympia
Habeas Corpus, Gus Bendjus Et Al.
The petitions herein wrote accusor to the retrun of Will Billings, Sheriff of Thurston County to the Writ of Habeas Corpus hereafter issued as follows:

1. They deny the authority of W.H. Bush to have petitioners confined in the jail of Thurston County or placed in the hands of Will Billings aforesaid for safe keeping us or all.
2. They deny of the sufficientcy of the warrants mentioned in the petitions and deny that they were duly issued.
3. They deny the validity of the indictments attached to the return by certified copy.

Sued for a accusorthey alleged:
1. Void the indictments are insufficient and void.
2. Void in the causes of #135 and 136 no offense or crime is alleged known to our statutes.
3. That the each fail to state any offense against petetioners.
4. That each of said indicments were found by a body of men assuming the findings of the Grand Jury.
5. That this Grand Jury in acting was not selected, drawn, surrounded, empowered or sown as transcribed by fail.
6. That none of said indictments are signed by the foreman of this Grand Jury.
7. That the names of all the witnesses attained before this, alleged Grand Jury are not enclosed in this indictments or any of them.
8. That names of the indictments were transcribed or marked filed as transcribed by the Code.
9. of the said Grand Jurors were before the Grand Juy demand the investigation of the charge or charges upon which these indictments are based.
10. That each of the indictments causes #135, 136 and 137, does not confine to the indictments of the code.
11. That all and each of the petions have been indicted, arrested, and are deprived of liberty without due process of law.
Bignold and Robinson Ally for Petitioners
